txt.en:
'The lies of this goblin cannot be believed!'

Durin's face is a thundercloud. He is angrier than you have ever seen him.

'I have not been controlled by the voice of Hrímil Frost-heart! I am no dragon's puppet!'
The goblin Glúrkub wants to tell you his side of the story. He is caged north of Maergrind and down one level, in Máttugard.
Prince Durin is furious, enraged with Glúrkub's story.
Talk to the prisoner and experience 'The Divided Loyalties of Glúrkub the Goblin'
Glúrkub is caged north of Maergrind and down one level, in Máttugard.
The goblin Glúrkub has a tale to tell, but whether or not he can be trusted is up to you and to the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ.
Talk to Durin by the cage

'My tale is a long one, yes, long and sad. But you will hear it, yes? You will see it? Put yourself in my shoes, walk around and see from my side?

'Maybe then you will know Glúrkub tells the truth, and Glúrkub can be trusted?

'Maybe then you let me go?'
'My story begins before your army came to Urbhármok, before this war of the dwarves. Hear it now, and know Glúrkub not to blame. Glúrkub just doing his best.'
Chapter 9.2: The Divided Loyalties of Glúrkub the Goblin
'That is my tale, and every word of it is true. Every word! Now you trust Glúrkub? Now you let him go?'
